meanings.definition: A type of fishing tackle consisting of a leader with a hook attached.
meanings.sent1: The fisherman carefully attached the snells to his fishing line before casting it into the water.
meanings.sent2: I bought some new snells for my fishing trip to catch bigger fish.
meanings.sent3: The snells on the fishing rod looked like tiny shiny swords ready to battle the fish.
meanings.sent4: The snells dangled like shiny jewels tempting the fish to take a bite.
meanings.sent5: The snells clinked softly as the fisherman prepared his gear, creating a soothing rhythm.

meanings.definition: To fasten a hook to a fishing line using a snell knot.
meanings.sent1: He snells the hook securely to the fishing line to ensure it doesn't come loose.
meanings.sent2: She always snells her hooks carefully to avoid losing any fish she catches.
meanings.sent3: The fish laughed at the clumsy angler who couldn't snell a hook properly.
meanings.sent4: His precision in snelling the hook was like a surgeon performing a delicate operation.
meanings.sent5: The way he snells the hook shows his expertise and dedication to fishing.
